messages: Ronald, take two men and secure the perimeter. No surprises tonight.
Lochan, see to the horses. They've had a long day.
You're quiet tonight, witch. Plotting your next move?
I'm eager to reach the capital, but this forest feels more dangerous than I expected.
Can't you sense it?

events.text: "And you wonder why we hunt your kind."
messages: You will remain in this cage throughout your trial and execution.
What do you want at the capital? Your life ends there.

events.text: "Please, you must understand why I'm here."
messages: I am a warning. An invasion is coming to your shores.
Except I think it's already here. I've found traces of a magic that shouldn't exist.
Something so dangerous it summons unstoppable celestial fire to --

events.alt: Warren Axim laughing mockingly, under the forest at night

messages: That's when the attack comes.
I watch wide-eyed as wolves dart from the forest understory. Flames pour from their eyes.
Enormous animals grab his men in their jaws and race through the bushes. The soldiers are too surprised to scream.
The horses are not.
What was that?
Where are my men?
WHAT DID YOU DO?
Wolves! And they... dragged into the forest like dolls!
Eyes burning with magic that I --
I can't see in this darkness, can't track those... those beasts.
But I can't let you out of my sight. For all I know, you caused this.
Damn, damn, damn.
But I can see the trails the wolves left behind.
Let me join you.
We can find them!
Give me a moment to unlock this thing.
Put one foot out of line and I'll give the wolves something else to eat.
Thanks, but I was just about to kill that thing myself.
You're... captain, why is she free?
Tracking the wolves in this darkness is more difficult than I expected.
She is able to see the paths left by those things.
It's the only way we found you.
Looks like I'll be carrying more than my own weight today.
Is this what you call an easy trip to the capital?
I am returning to the capital with a freed witch. I'm not losing my entire squad as well.
I thought you said this would be a routine mission.

events.text: "This is not the forest I grew up around."
messages: We need to be gone from here. Get your things.
Why are we out here hassling fishermen?
This isn't our beat.
This isn't what any of us signed up for.
I know.
Let's just get back.
We've been attacked, my squad is lost, and I'm cooperating with a witch.
What a disgrace.
Why can't you see the trails?
I grew up in this forest. I know the feel of every root and rock.
But I don't recognize it anymore. The birds are quiet. The bushes are still.
Is your magic suppressing nature?
Oh dear, you actually believe I'm a witch.
Ahh ha ha.
I'm afraid not.
You were lying to protect that girl?
Damn, damn. Damn!
What am I to tell the king? That I captured a broken witch?
You were so desperate that you'd take anything.
Don't worry. I'll try and put on a show.
It's not your magic. You can't do magic.
I had an actual witch in my hands and I let her go.
I'm going to lose my command for this.
... cannot believe this...
This isn't the expedition you wanted, is it?

events.text: "I'm not a fool. I know why I'm here."
messages: Crop yields are down, and the latest expansion into the forest hasn't bore fruit.
So why not send the city guard away to find a witch?
Hang her! Pretend that makes crops grow. See how well her blood makes fertilizer. Damn.
I would make a fine sacrifice.
But if that's the goal, then so would you.
I hate that I know it. I hate this pointless exercise. And I hate that you're making me confess it.
Easier to turn you in.

events.text: "It is easier to go along with a lie."
messages: Why not? So small at first.
And you're rewarded with power.
But the price of truth goes up so much faster.
No one above you to blame.
Watch the lie's dark ink flow as it holds a quill and signs your name. Threats, evictions, death warrants.
Whatever it demands.

events.text: Warren watches me with cold eyes.
messages: I deserve it.
My fault, my fault, my fault.
You are not Anartan. You don't fit with the villagers at Bluefin Waters.
Why are you here?

events.text: "I paid the price for my truth."
messages: A disaster is coming to my people, in Aurora. One I can't stop.
They are evacuating to this continent. Not to coexist but to conquer.
I want to warn anyone in power to be ready.
Such nonsense.
What proof do you have of any of this, beyond those ridiculous clothes?
I can tell you of the armaments of all three hundred and fifteen airships.
I can recite the names of the generals, the captains, the lieutenants. Every single one.
I can describe the magic that will be used to raze your cities and uproot your forests.
You have no magic, so you said.
No proof.

events.text: Stupid. I came here with nothing.
messages: My hands instinctually come together to form a sphere.
I rotate them, navigating the familiar lines and whorls of solar energy.
Nothing happens. My fists clench.
I will not cry in front of him.
We don't wait for the light to reach us. We take it from the source.
As much as we can.
I could trace through the layers of superheated gas to a well of power.
Our researchers find those paths and teach others.
You need to be gentle. Touching the wrong spot will burn you out.
I led a great team at the Arc Celeste.
We found the strongest paths, the safest spots. The most power.
In our glory we raised the Arc Celeste to the sky.
I can't even feel the sun's warmth on my skin.
It's not happy with my people.
And soon we will get more energy than we can handle.
In two weeks a solar flare will hit my homeland of Aurora and reduce it to a cinder.
Rather than accept our punishment, we are coming to wipe you out.
Everyone will be slaughtered.
That's the plan.
Then our society resumes as if nothing happened.
How could we resist such an invasion?
What chance does anyone have?
I renounced my Solar magic to leave Aurora undetected. I feel like a husk.
You had to be told. You're innocent. You could have a chance.
To die on your feet, I suppose.
What about that girl from the village?
Did she use Solar magic against my men?
It was something else.
I don't know what she was casting, or how, but I'd give anything to be able to do it.
If I had anything left.
The moss has grown over everything.
Chairs are all rotted.
Why haven't our scouts found this temple?

events.alt: A silver bowl resting in the hollow of an ancient tree, a drop of dew lies at the bottom

messages: Beautiful.
Oh, so much lighter than it looks.
Where have I smelled this before?
I know this, it's the, the...

events.alt: Sara holds the silver bowl that was resting in the hollow of an ancient tree

messages: Oh. Oh wow.
I feel warm again.
You must have heard that.
A tree outside crashed against the temple.
Something isn't happy with us here. Get up! Get! We need to go.

events.text: "They are not supposed to grow to that size."
messages: Check your injuries. Can everyone make it back to the capital?
I'm fine. Little too much drool today.
Same.
My dog's gonna be so mad at me.
You let her out. The cage is destroyed.
Are we just going to walk back to the capital with this witch?
Our mission hasn't changed. We're escor-
Taking her to the capital for a trial.
I'm glad everyone is alive. Collect your things.
